We arrived at the restaurant at 7.52 as the doors were just being opened. We entered thinking we could spend time having a drink before dinner. How foolish of me. We were told in no uncertain terms that we should leave as they were not fully open. Such lack of hospitality is bad business but to be told in such a rude way is just plain insulting.  So we waited and wandered until 8.10 when the restaurant was well and truly open. We entered but forgetfully we had not removed our cloaks of invisibility since the three staff present busied themselves with important jobs....apart from the key task of welcoming diners. They only recognised our presence when I complained about our treatment both current and earlier. We then left, booking reservation cancelled and gratified that my money was still in my pocket, not theirs. Hasta la vista? I don’t think so.

The red wine of the house blows one away: Really great ! And for only 20+ euro something.  I had tuna salad with tomatos, very rich portion of good quality. For the second I had ox steak with peppers. And you know what ? Never had anythng better ! Well, and I have really good restaurants of Italy and France on my record. Exceptionally good !!! Well, I think (no, I am sure), Spain has thousands and millions good restaurants. This was one of them, and it was worth every minute and every bite in it !

title_review: Excellent brunch in Madrid, perfect after a night out in Malasana
review_preview: Carmencita is an excellent brunch place in Madrid and is extremely popular amongst the American expats in Madrid.  Open daily from 12pm to 5pm you can have a decent brunch of huevos rancheros, eggs benedict (it is worth asking for the sauce on the side...
review_full: Carmencita is an excellent brunch place in Madrid and is extremely popular amongst the American expats in Madrid. Open daily from 12pm to 5pm you can have a decent brunch of huevos rancheros, eggs benedict (it is worth asking for the sauce on the side as they are extremely generous with it), a hamburger menu and omelettes.  The food is exellent, the prices are a little high but the food is worth the price. You can get a mimosa for only one euro or a large jug to share between people for 8 euros only. Every dish is around 8 to 9 euros. The restaurant is small, so making a booking is advised. There are also excellent cocktails for those who have not finished partying the night before. I highly recommend this place, it is a great restaurant to socialise with friends and enjoy a lazy Sunday.

review_preview: On Thursday 22/05/14, my husband and I were lucky enough to dine at La Castafiore. It is an evening we will not forget. We booked through a third party so our menu choice was limited and next time we go we will book directly with...
review_full: On Thursday 22/05/14, my husband and I were lucky enough to dine at La Castafiore. It is an evening we will not forget. We booked through a third party so our menu choice was limited and next time we go we will book directly with the restaurant for wider choice. I say next time because we will never stay in Madrid again without a visit to this wonderful restaurant. It is worth a visit for the friendly welcoming atmosphere and the wonderful performances of popular operatic pieces which even the most uninitiated opera novices (as my husband and I are) will recognise. The staff that evening were unique in that they included every diner in the restaurant to ensure maximum fun and involvement. I really cannot stress enough how a visit to La Castafiore will enhance a visit to Madrid. I had read in a review the advice to stay until the very end and I endorse this advice; stay and you won't be disappointed.

review_preview: We came here for Saturday brunch on a recent trip to Madrid. I found Carmencita from the great reviews on Yelp and TripAdvisor. When we arrived the restaurant was quite busy but we were seated within about 20 minutes. The staff were all extremely helpful...
review_full: We came here for Saturday brunch on a recent trip to Madrid. I found Carmencita from the great reviews on Yelp and TripAdvisor. When we arrived the restaurant was quite busy but we were seated within about 20 minutes. The staff were all extremely helpful and friendly. The menu was simple and had some of our favorite breakfast items listed. Mimosas were 1 Euro which is an excellent deal and they were delicious! We ordered French toast, hash browns, mushroom goat cheese scramble, and the American breakfast all of which were delicious. The benedicts looked divine. They were served on bagels. Everything was super fresh and perfectly cooked. We loved it so much we made reservations and came back the next day. We would most definitely eat here again. Tip: This place gets busy so make reservations!

title_review: I still think about the food!
review_preview: We went to Taberna del Capitan Alatriste on the recommendation of a friend.  She's a native Spaniard living in Madrid, so we trusted her not to lead us astray.  I'm so glad we followed her advice!  The restaurant is located in the La Latina neighborhood...
review_full: We went to Taberna del Capitan Alatriste on the recommendation of a friend. She's a native Spaniard living in Madrid, so we trusted her not to lead us astray. I'm so glad we followed her advice! The restaurant is located in the La Latina neighborhood near Calle Cava Baja. Calle Cava Baja is well known for it's abundance of restaurants and bars. With that being said, the area is popular amongst tourists and locals.  The restaurant is beautiful with a warm elegance. It has two levels, but still felt quite cozy. The food is unforgettable! Although a bit pricey, I can honestly say the price matches the quality. You get what you pay for. Service moved at a pleasant pace. We were a group of five with three of us being bilingual (English/Spanish). We didn't experience any sort of language barrier when we spoke in English. If it helps, the menus are in English and Spanish. For my entree, I had the grilled salmon. It was cooked to perfection and the portions were so generous! For dessert, I had the assorted ice creams and pears in wine. Please try the pears in wine! I can honestly say it was the best meal I had in Madrid.

review_preview: We had a night in Madrid while staying near the airport. One of the desk staff recommended we stroll around the area centered on Plaza San Andres for dinner.  We wanted tapas but we don't eat pork or ham, and many of the places along...
review_full: We had a night in Madrid while staying near the airport. One of the desk staff recommended we stroll around the area centered on Plaza San Andres for dinner. We wanted tapas but we don't eat pork or ham, and many of the places along Calle Don Pedro and the Calle Cava Baja were bursting with people. We came across the Capitan Alatriste and liked the menu. The staff were also very friendly inviting us in, with being hucksterish about it. We ate outside with about 8 other couples and families, several of whom seemed to be regulars. We had the best Sangria we've ever tasted, a fantastic Gazpacho, and Sea Bass and Salmon. The bass was good, the salmon was excellent. The staff answered questions, were attentive and their English was better than our Spanish provided freely and cheerfully. After the meal, one of the staff even got us started on our way back to the Opera Metro station. We'd have no problem coming back here if/when we make Madrid a destination rather than an overnight stop.

To the guy talking about the menu, you clearly didn't read... They have great breakfast foods, and as far as the juice, had you simply asked for fresh juice (like you have to do anywhere else in Madrid) you would have received the hand squeezed juice. To the people saying, "the place is a dive" "it's in a bad neighborhood".. really?? I honestly don't understand why/how you can lie on Tripadvisor just to make a place look bad when you KNOW that what you're saying is NOT true!.. Carmencita's is in a great neighborhood, and is as cute as they get when it comes to decor! They have great little deco type chairs and tables, with lovely flowers and candles on each one. It's one of the few bars/cafés in Madrid that when you walk in it doesn't smell like an old ashtray. This place is wonderful, the owners are wonderful and some of the nicest people you will ever meet! I go there about once a week for my hamburger fix, and have NEVER seen anyone walk out unhappy. I think for those people who come on here and say all of these negative things need to look at the stats of this place, it's wonderful... I have no idea when you went, or with what attitude you went there with.. but please, don't go back. Those of us who love and adore this place would rather not have you there.. Thanks :)

review_preview: Best Benedicts ever! So I am new to Madrid and I have been looking for a good American brunch since back in Clearwater my friends and I did brunch after every good night out. There have smoked salmon, avocado and bacon eggs benedict to choose...
review_full: Best Benedicts ever! So I am new to Madrid and I have been looking for a good American brunch since back in Clearwater my friends and I did brunch after every good night out. There have smoked salmon, avocado and bacon eggs benedict to choose from and I got to taste all three. AMAZING!! Also the Huevos Rancheros are to die for! I love Mexican food. I could definitely say I am a Mexican food brat.  The service was also amazing. I miss that good old American costumer service that doesn't seem to exist here in Spain. The bar is a cute small little place with amazing decor. we had mimosas for 1 euro each and the best bloody maries which had just enough spice to wake you up. The place is a burger joint during the week nights and they have brunch on the weekend days. I can’t wait to try the burgers.

review_preview: No trip to Madrid is ever complete without a trip to La Castafiore. Every time I return I hope that it will remain true to its principles and not sell out and become just another attraction for tourists. La Castafiore is an opportunity to experience...
review_full: No trip to Madrid is ever complete without a trip to La Castafiore. Every time I return I hope that it will remain true to its principles and not sell out and become just another attraction for tourists.  La Castafiore is an opportunity to experience Opera at very close quarters with the waiters and waitresses literally singing for your supper. Let me make it very clear I did not know I was a fan of Opera until I was taken here. Whether or not you think you like Opera this is a fantastic opportunity to experience it close up. This is not only about the music as you are served great food while the show goes on. We started with foie between us as the portions are very generous followed by Prawn and Hake brochettes which were excellent. We continued through desserts and coffees as the show builds to its finally way past midnight. As this was a Saturday night and most of the guests being local the party continued till well after 2am. There is no doubt that you will enjoy the experience more if you speak Spanish as most of your fellow guests especially at the weekends will be locals, but do not let this put you off as the staff will do there best to help you enjoy your night. Booking is essential especially at weekends, this can be done by phone or through the website. Expect to pay around 150 euros for 2 with drinks which is fantastic value for a great night out.

title_review: Delicious burgers+salads+brunch with vintage style and friendly service!
review_preview: Carmencita Bar is like Cheers - you start going regularly and you're greeted by name with a smile and you feel at home. It's a small corner bar near Malasaña with a relaxed atmosphere and vintage styling. The burgers are delicious with high quality fresh...
review_full: Carmencita Bar is like Cheers - you start going regularly and you're greeted by name with a smile and you feel at home. It's a small corner bar near Malasaña with a relaxed atmosphere and vintage styling. The burgers are delicious with high quality fresh meat brought from the region of León. Unlike most Spanish bars/restaurants, there is also a great variety of salads. If you want something more authentically Spanish, try the cecina (also from León) and ask for a small plate of olives + a glass of wine. The tostas are yummy as well, my personal favorite is the Champis - sauted mushrooms with avocado and cheese on top a toasted slice of bread. Weekends are the busiest for an American style brunch so it's best to make a reservation or expect to spend some time. There's always a good opportunity to practice your English or Spanish as the owner is fluent in both, but Tuesdays is the official intercambio night.

title_review: Another case of hyped up mediocrity
review_preview: This place is a tiny corner shop with 7 or so tables. It's not cute or authentic. There's no terrace, outdoor seating or special ambiance to speak of. Just a basic joint, which I don't mind as long as the food lives up to the...
review_full: This place is a tiny corner shop with 7 or so tables. It's not cute or authentic. There's no terrace, outdoor seating or special ambiance to speak of. Just a basic joint, which I don't mind as long as the food lives up to the hype. It doesn't. The owner / keeper has an English menu and speaks English, which is where the pros run dry. On the day of our visit their menu had literally four breakfast items to choose from, each a €8.50 "Benedict" consisting of a slice of toasted bread the size of a deck of cards, an egg, a meager piece of salmon (in my case), all drenched in hollandaise sauce, accompanied by deep fried pre-fabricated hash browns briquettes. If you expect nourishment to hold you over through a day of city hopping, don't. I'm not a glutton, but I have an athletic diet which requires substance. Even If I wanted to get something else, which wasn't booze, fat or sugar, there was nothing else on the menu, except another Huevo. An hour and €25 later we ended up looking for another place to eat. Preposterous. While at Carmencita I ordered two glasses of fresh orange juice and was treated to something which tasted like Minute Maid. When asked why we were served some yellow liquid from a can when the place had a perfectly fine juice making machine, the answer was "I thought that's the kind you wanted". There are 3,500+ restaurants in Madrid. To be ranked #17, the place has to be truly exceptional. In my opinion the most exceptional part about Carmencita Bar is how they were able to weasel their way to a such a prominent rating on TA. If you are the kind of traveler who seeks "America" everywhere you go, you'll be fine here. Just be prepared to pay twice as much for twice as little. Otherwise, do yourself a favor and explore this wonderful city and don't settle for mediocrity.

review_preview: Carmencita is the perfect place to go with friends. Their weekend brunch is classic, with French Toast, Eggs Benedict (with avocado or salmon) and even a great version of the Mexican classic, Huevos Rancheros. Add an 8 euro pitcher of mimosas and you have the...
review_full: Carmencita is the perfect place to go with friends. Their weekend brunch is classic, with French Toast, Eggs Benedict (with avocado or salmon) and even a great version of the Mexican classic, Huevos Rancheros. Add an 8 euro pitcher of mimosas and you have the perfect place to spend Saturday and Sunday afternoons. And during normal hours, they have the best burgers in Madrid as well as other delights including proper tapas with your canas.  And all this for a great price so you find a lot of regular locals there. They also host intercambios on Tuesdays so you can practice your Spanish, or English over a cana or two.  The atmosphere is cozy and cute but small so reservations for brunch are recommended.

title_review: The new presentation is a great disappointment
review_preview: Have visited La Castafiore several times over the years and always enjoyed the experience. While the food was indifferent and the service hit and miss one came for the performance which never ceased to impress. That is until our last visit! The waiting staff are...
review_full: Have visited La Castafiore several times over the years and always enjoyed the experience. While the food was indifferent and the service hit and miss one came for the performance which never ceased to impress. That is until our last visit! The waiting staff are assisted by a number of "resting" or out of work opera singers who sing various arias from popular operas. Nor for the serious opera buff for sure but great fun for those who enjoy opera occasionally. Over the years they had a great formula which seemed to work brilliantly. That's all changed now. The new lead singers seem to want to denigrate any pretensions that this is serious opera. They even mocked one of their number who sang "Happy Birthday" in Italian to one delighted table in the classic pose with both hands clasped behind his back. That sort of behaviour should be left behind in the dressing room. The show finished off with a cringe making clap around to some popular Spanish numbers that have never been performed in an Opera House anywhere. So more Variety Show than Opera. Fair enough I suppose if you are aiming to please an audience of pre teen school children. Though even they I don't think would enjoy it. What seems to have happened here is an inverted form of Opera snobbery <If you want Opera go to real opera at the Opera House don't expect to find it here sung by waiters> Sad.

And can't forget about the delicious rioja for ~$3.50 a glass.

Great cakes, good brunch and superb hamburgers. Prices are aligned with those of other good places nearby, but they are even a bit more competitive when considering menu options.  The place gets crowded, particularly in the weekends. However, the restaurant is composed of two separated spaces, that are in the same street, a few steps from each other, and share the same kitchen and similar interior design. So, even if you show up in the weekend and without reservation, you shouldn't wait too long.

review_preview: We own a travel company focused on high end travel for Americans.  (since 1976)  In Madrid last week, we had one of our most memorable travel experiences in over 35 visits to Spain, the Opera singing waitpersons at the La Castafiore.  If you have only...
review_full: We own a travel company focused on high end travel for Americans. (since 1976) In Madrid last week, we had one of our most memorable travel experiences in over 35 visits to Spain, the Opera singing waitpersons at the La Castafiore. If you have only one meal in Madrid, make it at this unusual restaurant. The service is terrific and the cuisine excellent. But it is the singing during the course of the meal by professional opera singers that will leave a permanent smile on you face, chills down your spine and your hands red from applauding. Did not see many tourists here, locals mainly.  The coup de grace was the gratis cava served with dessert.  We are going back in May, and it will be our first stop.

Food, service and ambiance were all very good but what sets this place apart is the performance by the singing waiters and waitresses. Five or six excellent singers performing classic familiar operatic pieces both during the meal and after. Engaging personalities, great music, the entire restaurant was enthralled. You don't need to be an opera buff to enjoy a wonderful evening at La Castafiore.

title_review: Wonderful Surprise , don't be fooled by the looks
review_preview: We visited this restaurant by  luck, we  were suppose to go to a different restaurant but when we got there it was full, no tables , so we used the tripadvisor app and voila Marcano was recommended  by my fellow critics.When we got there...
review_full: We visited this restaurant by luck, we were suppose to go to a different restaurant but when we got there it was full, no tables , so we used the tripadvisor app and voila Marcano was recommended by my fellow critics. When we got there at almost 9pm the restaurant was empty and I mean no customers not one. Usually when I see a place that deserted i din go in at all but we were a party of 6 and it was cold , so we decided to stay. First they bought us an appetizer on the house small portions but full of flavor excellent!!!, the we decided to share some more appetizers squid on his ink which was extremely well prepared and cooked and a foie gra that was also really good. So Far All plates exceeded our expectations, then 3 of us decided to order the signature dish of the house which was Ternera Blanca, a piece of the calf of the cow slow cooked for 54 hrs on a bed of a truffle mashed potato, let me tell you it did not disappoint. the other 3 companions ordered the tartare which was also excellent. They were serving us very good food and we were so happy to be there, service was very good and they were paying attention to all of our needs. Desert came and shared 4 of them the creme brulee was ok but the texturas the chocolate and the cheese cake made from manchego was out of this world. By the end they finished our memorable meal with a piece of round crepe with a cube of a guaba on top that exploded in our mouths as soon as you had the bite. The check came and it was a moderate price considering what just happened, I hihly recommend this place  I am definitely going to visit the restaurant again for lunch before I leave to taste the bison and the corvina.

title_review: Pleasant outdoor dining with carefully prepared food and good service
review_preview: We ate at La Taberna del Capitan Alatriste on the recommendation of our tour guide, Andreas. It was clear to me why it is a local favorite, The outdoor setting is on a quiet. side street away from the crowds but close to Madrid attractions....
review_full: We ate at La Taberna del Capitan Alatriste on the recommendation of our tour guide, Andreas. It was clear to me why it is a local favorite, The outdoor setting is on a quiet. side street away from the crowds but close to Madrid attractions. Although it is quiet, there is plenty of activity nearby for people watching. The restaurant had an elegant ambiance, but was very reasonably priced. Service was attentive. It was perfect for a light lunch. The salads were especially good and fresh. My favorite tapas was a croquette that had a bechemel filling. This restauarbnt is a cut above all the tapas places lining the nearby Plaza Mayor.

review_preview: Certainly one of Madrid's best tables. Superb food. Basic idea of most dishes is the combination of a one modest ingredient with a luxury one: veal shank with truffels, partridge with white beans, artichokes with stewed vegetables, tuna with sea urchin.Chef owner hails from...
review_full: Certainly one of Madrid's best tables. Superb food. Basic idea of most dishes is the combination of a one modest ingredient with a luxury one: veal shank with truffels, partridge with white beans, artichokes with stewed vegetables, tuna with sea urchin. Chef owner hails from the Arzak dynasty - concentrated flavours. Top class dishes are complete fish served in portions for two or more, and the pigeon. Not a low budget restaurant, but definitely very good value considering the quality.  Desserts way above what is customary in Madrid - eg the apple pie. Wine list is short and modest, but extremely good value. A few minor blemishes. Terrible music torture, airco too hot and too dry, and some of the staff clearly without experience and not used to deal with (foreign) customers eating out of the standard formulas. That should not stop you from going.

title_review: Elegant, chill, intimate bar scene with exquisite tapas
review_preview: One of my good friends who lives right around the corner from this place recommended it to me several months ago, and somehow it had slipped off the culinary radar for me during the holidays. Not anymore! It's in the top 5 on our list...
review_full: One of my good friends who lives right around the corner from this place recommended it to me several months ago, and somehow it had slipped off the culinary radar for me during the holidays.  Not anymore! It's in the top 5 on our list of this neighborhood. We started out with a kind welcome from the young bartender who then served us two well poured canas of Mahou. The tapa was grilled pork tenderloin with a creamy potato pure sprinkled with paprika - succulent! Next, we decided to order two glasses of white wine - Godin (Godello) and La Trucha (Albarino) - both were delicious and served at the perfect temperature. The tapa was two mejillones served with what I think was a light Pedro Jimenez reduction sauce - perfect combination with the white wine. The bar is small but comfortable. The service was affable and attentive. The music was what I would call Brazilian Afro Beat / Jazz, definitely cool. We left impressed and looking forward to our next visit.

We chose Hache based on the reviews, and had an absolutely wonderful experience. Two of us had the salad that consisted of arugula, mozzarella, mushrooms, and a very nice dressing. The mozzarella just melted in your mouth. Yum!! The other party had the croquettes, and they were delicious as well. We ordered four different deserts and shared them. I think my favorite was the homemade Mojito ice cream. It was so light and refreshing, perfect for the hot summer day. But don't get me wrong, the other deserts were absolutely scrumptious as well! I am still dreaming about that salad. If only I could get something like that here at home! Though we didn't ask, it seemed that the staff may have been a husband and wife team. The gentleman was so very helpful with the ordering process. None of us spoke Spanish, so conversing with the wife was not really possible, but they were very friendly and welcoming!

We booked via the TA site, The Fork, which promised us 40% off our meal and we booked online for 8.00pm (which it says is when the restaurant is open - as does the dor sign at the restaurant. I checked their website too to get an idea of menu prices and saw that mains were about 17 -18 euro so expected 40% off that)  Arriving just after 8, we surprised one of the staff as she mopped the floors and she did not know we had booked. No, there was a mistake, the restaurant doesn't open until 8.30, come back then... So we came back then...and the menu looked promising but also told us that the prices on the menu were at 40% off... but everyone got the same menu so where were the "real" prices and who ever got charged those? It was a bit of a have, we reckon to advertise 40% off. Its really not, as nowhere are the full prices advertised, the mains were exactly as on the web. Other than that, we enjoyed our meal, so don't get me wrong, I would recommend this restaurant, just don't expect to get a cheap deal.

With 3 drinks as well, the bill was only €50 for three of us. The have menus in English and an entire black board of specials( only in Spanish) but the staff are wonderful so would probably translate!

review_preview: Txirimiri has four locations and we happened to stumble upon the restaurant located in the Moncloa-Rosales neighborhood.  We checked out the reviews using the TA City Guide App and decided to test out the restaurant.  Based on the reviews I suspect there is a variation...
review_full: Txirimiri has four locations and we happened to stumble upon the restaurant located in the  Moncloa-Rosales neighborhood. We checked out the reviews using the TA City Guide App and decided to test out the restaurant. Based on the reviews I suspect there is a variation in the Txirimiri dinning experience depending on which location you visit. The inside of the restaurant is nice, bright with a welcoming open floor plan and upbeat music. The staff were helpful and more than willing to work with our lack of Spanish - which was much appreciated. The restaurant has a number specials written up on a black board which adds some important depth to the menu. While we enjoyed the atmosphere and service, fundamentally the food was not that good. The cannelloni noodle was too soft the accompanying sauce was luke warm (microwave?). The chef used far too much truffle oil on the ravioli which overpowered any of the other flavors in the ravioli (as well as the other dishes at the table). The highlight was cod tempura - nicely cooked with great flavor. Based on the reviews I might be willing to try the Txirimiri located in the La Latin neighborhood; however I would probably not return to the restaurant in the Moncloa-Rosales (www.txirimiri.es)

title_review: Amazingly great food, beautiful restaurant and wonderful staff!!
review_preview: We were leaving the Royal Palace and it was lightly raining and we were looking for a place to eat and ducked into Hache.  Wow - very happy we stopped.  Danny was behind the bar and welcomed us in.  We spoke with him and I...
review_full: We were leaving the Royal Palace and it was lightly raining and we were looking for a place to eat and ducked into Hache. Wow - very happy we stopped. Danny was behind the bar and welcomed us in. We spoke with him and I ordered a Mojito and my daughter ordered a Bloody Mary. My Mojito was great (I am Cuban American, so well acquainted with a good Mojito), but the Bloody Mary was one of the best I have ever tasted!! Danny came over and told us his recipe with great pride - the ingredients were top quality and not the typical BM recipe - it was evident that he had done quite a bit of experimenting to come up with this amazing cocktail. It was so great to see the care he took.  We then looked at the menu and asked him for his recommendations. He was so helpful and it was very evident that he was very proud of their food, but most of all, he wanted to ensure that our experience was great! We ordered the ceviche, a salmon appetizer and some croquettes that I believe were Yucca - unbelievable how great each one was. The quality, care and pride that goes into each dish is very evident!  Francisco then came over and started chatting with us. My daughter and I do speak Spanish as a second language, but he was perfectly comfortable in English as well. You can tell there is great passion and pride in their food and drink and you also feel the care and concern in ensuring that your overall experience is excellent! Francisco and Danny made us feel so welcome and you could see their joy in the fact that we enjoyed and loved the food they carefully prepared for us!  By the way, the restaurant itself is beautiful! Distressed brick walls, exposed wood - beautiful and warm. Danny then brought us over a small post dinner drink - another amazing concoction that he made that was just truly amazing.  I love to cook and love fresh ingredients and Hache is spectacular. If you are in Madrid, this is a must do!! The restaurant is beautiful and warm, the food is fresh and excellent - it is evident that they take great pride in the flavors and ingredients that they present to their patrons - and Francisco and Danny were so warm and welcoming - it all combines to be an exceptional experience!

review_preview: My wife and I found this restaurant on Trip Advisor- our first meal out in Madrid. The owner and his wife were charming, the service was excellent and the ambiance lovely. The building is over 100 years old but has been restored to create a...
review_full: My wife and I found this restaurant on Trip Advisor- our first meal out in Madrid. The owner and his wife were charming, the service was excellent and the ambiance lovely. The building is over 100 years old but has been restored to create a really warm and friendly space. Just loved the brickwork and the oak woodwork. Now for the food. We had three courses. The starters were well prepared and preceded by small complementary tapas- a nice gesture. The mains were excellent and the deserts even better. What can I say....a really enjoyable evening, very pleased we picked Hache as our first dining experience. Fully recommend it to future diners...find it, go there, book early, don't be disappointed. Ps...chose the Riocha...a fruity red wine choice....will enhance your meal! Top marks from us this time. Enjoy!!

review_preview: Our night had hardly started well as our friend was ill, which made us late for our reservation. However the staff did everything they could do to secure a table for us. They were also incredibly accommodating to our friend who was not well, constantly...
review_full: Our night had hardly started well as our friend was ill, which made us late for our reservation. However the staff did everything they could do to secure a table for us. They were also incredibly accommodating to our friend who was not well, constantly attending to her. I had their stewed ribs, which fell apart to the touch, it was by far the best thing I ate in Spain. My husband had a great sweet and sour risotto, although I would warn others that in the translated menu, they call it sticky rice. So it wasn't exactly what he was expecting.  The whole table enjoyed the wonderful meal along with the gorgeous bottle of wine.  The atmosphere is so cosy, I only wish there was somewhere comparable at home in London!  It was also a great location to go for an after dinner walk, towards the city for some change cocktails. title_review: A 'must do' for Madrid/best food experience in Europe
review_preview: A restaurant that is only 3 months old but with the service and quality of an establishment that has been there for decades.This is easily the best meal my husband and I have had in Europe over approximately ten years of travel throughout the...
review_full: A restaurant that is only 3 months old but with the service and quality of an establishment that has been there for decades. This is easily the best meal my husband and I have had in Europe over approximately ten years of travel throughout the continent. These are the reasons hache has to be on your to do list in Madrid.  1) customer service: Francisco and his staff are clearly passionate about what they do and are committed to making the customer experience a priority. Language was no barrier and our meals were carefully explained and suggestions for meals made well.  2) food: spectacular quality food prepared in modern and innovative ways. The combination of flavours and portion sizes were spot on. We left feeling fully satisfied but not bloated. We've been struggling to find high quality food in Madrid and finally found it at hache. 3) quality of drinks: do not miss the opportunity to have a cocktail at hache. The bar man is very talented and we were lucky enough to have him create some concoctions for us based on our spirit of preference. Interesting, well balanced, perfect!  4) ambience : as a new restaurant the interiors are warm, fresh, and inviting. We were looking for a quick meal and an early night but had such a great experience that we ended up staying for a few hours.  This review may sound gushing, but it's fully deserved. Thank you again Francisco and the team at hache!

review_preview: Last night in Madrid and being a Saturday, the streets around Gran Via were crazily busy. Decided to find this restaurant away from the crowds after reading good reviews and we were not disappointed. We were welcomed in even though the restaurant was not yet...
review_full: Last night in Madrid and being a Saturday, the streets around Gran Via were crazily busy. Decided to find this restaurant away from the crowds after reading good reviews and we were not disappointed. We were welcomed in even though the restaurant was not yet open. The seating area was warm and comfortable and the owners made you feel as you were welcome in their home. Discreet jazz music instantly relaxed you. Food was truly delicious. I had the scallops followed by red tuna, my husband had the cheese selection and Iberian pork. Both followed with a tangerine and cava sorbet then an Irish coffee before going back out in the cold. Appetisers were gorgeous and even the bread was tasty. What sets this apart is that the owners and waiters seem to genuinely want you to enjoy their food and enjoy your evening. Some people may say the dishes are pricey however the meal was memorable and in hindsight offered great value for money. If we ever visit Madrid again we can only hope we can get a reservation. We wish them well for a truly successful venture.

Not recommended unless you love soy sauce with fish / burger disguised as beef cheek!

review_preview: This was our last night in Madrid and we were looking for some innovative authentic Spanish cruise. Unfortunately we chose Hache. Hache by name and hash by experience. This is a restaurant where style presides over substance and appetite for income presides over good service....
review_full: This was our last night in Madrid and we were looking for some innovative authentic Spanish cruise. Unfortunately we chose Hache. Hache by name and hash by experience. This is a restaurant where style presides over substance and appetite for income presides over good service. This is the first time where we have been asked to leave without warning in the middle of our pudding to give way to the next customer on the conveyor belt of greed. The food was very mixed. The man in charge doesn't know what a marinade is. Please give the pheasant dish a miss this poor creature died in vain! Both main dishes contained no flavour whatsoever and were vastly over priced. My pheasant claimed to be in a ginger sauce. Sadly no vague presence of ginger was detectable. The meatballs were edible. I wish with hindsight I had left after them. Shockingly poor sweet choices too!  Having had such better quality food in London it makes one realise how bad everyday Spanish cuisine really is compared to France, Italy and Greece.

review_preview: We found place through tripadvisor and decided to give it a try. We wanted to have something different vs. all the tapas places in Madrid. Later we also learned that the place had been opened in March 2016. Well, as a starter we had a...
review_full: We found place through tripadvisor and decided to give it a try. We wanted to have something different vs. all the tapas places in Madrid. Later we also learned that the place had been opened in March 2016. Well, as a starter we had a tuna tartar on an guacamole bed. Absolutely fantastic. I felt the need of licking the plate :-) thereafter we had the Entrecote & potatoes. Nicely done and I have to mention that the potatoes were really well done; just right. We had a glass of cava to begin with and that was one of the glasses of cava for a long time. They also have champagne in the list for a good price (48€ for a bottle of Bollinger..), but I would still try the cava. Very dry and crisp. For the streak, we got a bottle of Ribera de Duero by Rento. Absolutely beautiful wine! To finish we had a chocolate brownie which was good as well. The service was very good and we really felt like coming back to this place. Warmly recommended to all food lovers.

title_review: Cute Restaurant, great food and value.
review_preview: I booked Hache via Trip Advisor last minute and had a great evening and meal during our weekend in Madrid. The service was excellent, the Manager/host of the restaurant was very kind and welcoming and our server was polite and prompt. The ambience of the...
review_full: I booked Hache via Trip Advisor last minute and had a great evening and meal during our weekend in Madrid. The service was excellent, the Manager/host of the restaurant was very kind and welcoming and our server was polite and prompt. The ambience of the restaurant was lovely and romantic, exposed brick walls and rustic table settings. The food was delicious and well presented. review_preview: This was the last meal my wife and I were going to have on our honeymoon so we wanted it to be good. Upon arrival, we were warmly greeted by the owner, Francisco, who said it was either the best or worst decision we just...
review_full: This was the last meal my wife and I were going to have on our honeymoon so we wanted it to be good. Upon arrival, we were warmly greeted by the owner, Francisco, who said it was either the best or worst decision we just made.  Long story short, it was the best. Let's recap.  1. We were originally a bit skeptical because of the 40% discount if you made your reservation through TripAdvisor. However, when the complimentary tapas was served, we were hooked. I can't really describe it and we both don't like goat cheese. However, we were so surprised that the cheese on it was in fact goat cheese. Wow.  2. We ordered risotto and ceviche, both were the best we've had on the trip. Portions were quite large as well. I ordered a small steak tartare which was good as well. Just wasn't a fan of the olives as I'm not an olive person.  3. We ordered the steak and Iberian pork. Omg, at 20 euros for the steak, before the discount, it was honestly one of the best steaks I've ever had. The Iberian pork, were incredible. We were a bit concerned about the very pinkish color, but were reassured it was okay to eat. Also, wow best pork ever.  4. Finally, although stuffed, we had to order desserts. We ordered the tiramisu and chocolate brownie. Incredible. These desserts do not leave you filling stuffed or bloated.  Ultimately, one of the best meals we've ever had in our lives. If there is no longer the discount, still make it a priority to go. The decor is homely and rustic. Photos are of Francisco's family and friends. The food Is priced very reasonably and we will always drop by when we're ever back in Madrid.  Thanks for the incredible dinner and service!

title_review: Unusual level of food experience, for such a tiny little Restaurant
review_preview: I went to taberna Marcano after reading all the excellent reviews! I have a mixed feeling about this place! No doubt the food is excellent! The prices are a bit higher than I expected, but I think it worths the experience itself. Mind you the...
review_full: I went to taberna Marcano after reading all the excellent reviews! I have a mixed feeling about this place!  No doubt the food is excellent! The prices are a bit higher than I expected, but I think it worths the experience itself.  Mind you the restaurabt is tiny. There are 2 small tables in the lower ground area next to the toilets. And luckily I was not sitting there. On the mid level between the ground and 1st floor there is a bar area and 4 high cabaret style tables. Definitely need a prior reservation. Apparently the chef is known and he is very good.  I actually was tempted by the photos of specific dishes in the trip advisor, however non of the dishes were available. Because the chef uses only seasonal products and those were not available. So they offered different dishes which were good! I paid 54 euros for 2 dishes with 1 glass of wine. I certainly recommend! However I still find it pricey. Not in comparison with others. Just for myself.

review_preview: Myself and a few friends visited Madrid last May/June and while there tried out a number of Restaurants and I can honestly say that De Maria was far superior to the others.  It is just off the main square in the centre of Madrid.  There...
review_full: Myself and a few friends visited Madrid last May/June and while there tried out a number of Restaurants and I can honestly say that De Maria was far superior to the others. It is just off the main square in the centre of Madrid. There are different sections to the Restaurant, it seemed to have 3 sections, a place where you can sit and eat outside, another Restaurant just inside and a Restaurant at the back, As it was raining we went inside but to the back Restaurant which had a different more expensive menu. It was really nice but we asked one waiter if we could have the different Menu (the set menu - which obviously they didn't do in this section), his English was not very good but he said no and left us there. Then Maria came along and what a fantastic waitress, her English was perfect, she helped us and what a wonderful evening we had. It was our last evening in Madrid and we were so disappointed we hadn't found this Restaurant when we first arrived. Maria made our evening, she was able to help us with our choice of food. She was absolutely fantastic. I actually thought she must have owned the Restaurant and asked her if this was the case, but she said she just worked there. I would certainly recommend this Restaurant and hope you are lucky enough to have Maria serve you. She was just brilliant,

Would try them again.

title_review: Every  single dish is a delicate expression of the best in Spanish cuisine.
review_preview: Having grown up in this city I can say I know a thing or two about good food. This tiny spot is by far one of the best restaurants in Madrid. Chef David Marcano, who worked with renowned chef Arzak, treats his food with  the...
review_full: Having grown up in this city I can say I know a thing or two about good food. This tiny spot is by far one of the best restaurants in Madrid.  Chef David Marcano, who worked with renowned chef Arzak, treats his food with the same grace and respect as he treats his clients. As soon, as you sit down, you're offered something to drink, always served with some wonderful tapas like seasoned olives and a small bowl of silky gazpacho. You could be easily satisfied with that experience but the choices of appetizers and entrées is varied and just as lovely: croquetas, tortilla española, tuna tartare and merluza among many more, all accompanied by a great wine list. You will not be dissappointed!

After dessert, they brought two carafes containing limoncello and a licorice drink. These were also complimentary! We, along with all the other guests, were presented with one gift after the other, which made us feel very welcome. The service was highly professional. Price was very reasonable. The restaurant was filled to capacity on Sunday afternoon, with many local patrons. I would go back in a heartbeat.

We were dazzled from the get go with complimentary cava (sparkling wine) and were still treated royally after we had finished our meal with several complimentary deserts and free apertif (post meal) liquors. title_review: So you say you like meat and wine?  Let me introduce you to De Maria.
review_preview: We had only a one night stop in Madrid before flying home to the US and our hotel recommended De Maria as a nice restaurant for dinner.  After a week of enjoying seafood, we all zeroed in on the word "steak" and decided to give...
review_full: We had only a one night stop in Madrid before flying home to the US and our hotel recommended De Maria as a nice restaurant for dinner. After a week of enjoying seafood, we all zeroed in on the word "steak" and decided to give it a try. You are right in the city center on their patio, but the street is quiet enough that you don't even notice all the hustle and bustle going by.  Service was fantastic and included many generous components "on the house." We started with complementary Cava and cheese and bread appetizers as well as a delicious soup. And rounded out the meal with more complimentary liqueurs than we probably should have been trusted with.  We all chose various steak entrees with my husband and I sharing the loin for two (which they were able to cook to both of our preferences!) and enjoyed a delicious red wine recommended by our server.  But the absolute best part of the meal was the dessert. The server highly recommended a traditional Argentinian dessert with caramel and whipped cream that was a mix between Dulce De Leche and Alfajor and the result was Delicious.

title_review: Top quality, well presented food and great service in nice surroundings
review_preview: My wife and I dined at this restaurant after booking through fork ... have to say what a really good find.  Made to feel very welcome from the moment we arrived until we left, couple who run the restaurant were very attentive and were clearly...
review_full: My wife and I dined at this restaurant after booking through fork ... have to say what a really good find. Made to feel very welcome from the moment we arrived until we left, couple who run the restaurant were very attentive and were clearly passionate about their restaurant. Good wine selection and very reasonably priced too. We opted to share a starter of meatballs with goats cheese which was very tasty. Nice touch in between courses was the aperitif of shot of gazpacho with salsa and a plantain chip, unexpected but was bursting with flavour. My wife chose the sea bass dish for her main and after I tried we both agreed that this was the nicest well cooked sea bass we have eaten (we've ate a similar dish at Marco Pierre Whites restaurant). For myself I chose the pork dish which again was well cooked with some interesting flavours which I was more than pleased with. We were tempted to order a dessert by our host as he was passionate about their chefs homemade options so we opted for a tiramisu to share. Have to say what was sold to us was delivered as once again we received a delightful dish. All in all I would certainly recommend dining at this restaurant and is very good value for money.

It looks like a great spot for drinks/dinner as well. This is a terrific, non-touristy option in the neighborhood of the Palacio Real. Highly recommended!

Meal was topped off with a complimentary dessert drink and THEN a little Limoncelo to end the evening. Service was spot on-- changing plates and serviceware between each course. The only markdown deMaria receives is for the additional 10% on the bill due to terrace seating- not necessary and a tourist gouge in my estimation. BUT, that said, I would return if staying near Puerto del Sol.

title_review: De Maria Parrilla-Correa restaurant just off Puerta Del Sol in Madrid
review_preview: Staying with my husband at the Hotel Europa overlooking the Puerta Del Sol in Madrid and we walked across the plaza and down a side street Calle del Correo to find the best restaurant ever, De Maria. I think there might be a few more...
review_full: Staying with my husband at the Hotel Europa overlooking the Puerta Del Sol in Madrid and we walked across the plaza and down a side street Calle del Correo to find the best restaurant ever, De Maria. I think there might be a few more restaurants with the same name elsewhere but this one is just right off the Puerta del Sol. We were welcomed inside by a friendly and super busy maitre D who kept an eye on all tables through the evening. The staff were attentive and very efficient. We have had an interest in restaurants in the past and it was evident this restaurant was run like a well oiled machine. We were impressed from the get go. When you sit down you are presented with a complimentary sparkling rose, a gazpacho refresher, a plate of plump green olives, fresh bread and a plate of cream cheese with small zwiebacks. My husband had blood sausage as entree which was soft and delicately spiced.This came with complimentary salsas.He ordered a glass of dry white house wine and a bottle of still water. His main dish was a sirloin steak and I ordered the house Speciality De Maria chicken with ham and mushroom sauce. We ordered a side of potato fries and steamed Brocolli and potatoes. Both main dishes were superb. We were completely full by now and refused dessert but we're given complimentary Mango sorbet smoothies(that's the closest description I can come up with) and small shot glasses of yoghurt and mango coulis. My husband had two further glasses of white wine and an espresso coffee and the whole meal came to only 73 euros which for two Aussies from Melbourne (one of the most expensive liveable cities in the world) was astonishingly good value. Please please try this place out and tell me if I am right about it. We loved it so much we are going back tonight for our final meal in Madrid. Enjoy

review_preview: Considering this restaurant is just off the main square (Sol) in Madrid, the food and service were very good and we enjoyed it so much, we came back a couple of days later and ordered the same food.It's really an Argentinian steak house, but...
review_full: Considering this restaurant is just off the main square (Sol) in Madrid, the food and service were very good and we enjoyed it so much, we came back a couple of days later and ordered the same food. It's really an Argentinian steak house, but we only had salad and pasta and these were very good. The staff were friendly, happy to be working there, and when we returned the waiter shook our hand to welcome us. When you sit down, you get a glass of cava, bread, melba toast with cream cheese, and olives, all gratis. We shared the quinoa salad, but really it was leaves, with a delicious mustard dressing, peeled prawns and cherry tomatoes. Fantastic.  For mains, my wife had the salmon raviola in a prawn sauce. It was superb, so good I was so jealous of it I wiped the plate clean with bread to soak up all the sauce, and then when we returned a couple of days later we got one each, it was so good. A bid rich, but what the hell, you're on holiday. You must order this dish. While we were eating, a table of Frenchies sat next to us, and I told them they had to try it. Three from the four did, and the one who didn't told me he wished he had too, after tasting his wife's portion. After mains, they bring you a lovely gratis duo of desserts, including a palate-cleansing sorbet. On our second visit I ordered the millefeuille, which I have to say was very disappointing - it was not a classic millefueille at all, and I really didn't like it or finish it. But don't let that put you off. We really enjoyed this restaurant and would recommend it.

review_preview: Really awesome food. Nice setup but totally unpretentious atmosphere. It's a dig that seemed to me like a well kept secret. Value/money is perfect. I went with a party of 7 for our Xmas get-together. We always try and find nice restaurants but we don't...
review_full: Really awesome food. Nice setup but totally unpretentious atmosphere. It's a dig that seemed to me like a well kept secret. Value/money is perfect. I went with a party of 7 for our Xmas get-together. We always try and find nice restaurants but we don't place all our money on super quality food, the important part is the get-together. Generally we pick well and get get both, quality time and good food. Yesterday we got an absolute plus on the good food side, it was truly excellent! We shared some starters that were great, and then each of us had a main -- all of them were devastatingly, decadently great. I would totally recommend the "garbazos with morcilla and foie", and the "rabo de vaca". Those were the super hits, but then everything else, "lasagna", "duck" ... everything was really perfect. Same goes with deserts, we got three to share and there are 2 that I found awesome, the cheese tart and the "torrija". The staff was great, kind and serviceable- one could feel they appreciated their own servings. One of the best finds for me in Madrid in a long time!

review_preview: This small local restaurant right near to of my other favorites in the neighborhood, El Capricho and La Castela, surprised me with its attentive service and eclectic takes on the typical.For example, we ordered beef tail in a zesty and creamy curry sauce that...
review_full: This small local restaurant right near to of my other favorites in the neighborhood, El Capricho and La Castela, surprised me with its attentive service and eclectic takes on the typical. For example, we ordered beef tail in a zesty and creamy curry sauce that was succulent and daring. Then we ordered a plate of pumpkin ravioli served with a creamy cheesy hazelnut sauce that was something out of the ordinary. The service was exemplary, especially the nice touch of letting taste some of the wines before ordering them by the glass.  We ate at the bar, which was more than comfortable. With that said, the dining room is quite small, maybe sits 20, so if you plan on going with a group, beware you could be a little squished. In any case, I look forward to my next visit and to trying some other interesting nouveau dishes.

review_preview: Good steakhouse in downtown Madrid.We were welcomed with a glass courtesy sparkling wine.  Also, courtesy bread, gaspacho shots, mini toasts and cream cheese and later on, after the meal, courtesy glasses of mango sorbet and digestive drinks.  Lots of courtesy items which may give...
review_full: Good steakhouse in downtown Madrid. We were welcomed with a glass courtesy sparkling wine. Also, courtesy bread, gaspacho shots, mini toasts and cream cheese and later on, after the meal, courtesy glasses of mango sorbet and digestive drinks. Lots of courtesy items which may give you the idea of the kind of attention to service at this place. Beef was great, tender, cooked as requested, great taste, salt only, prime cut of Solomillo (filet mignon). Absolutely loved it. The restaurant is located on a relatively quiet street only thirty feet from a major avenue. They have covered outdoor seating on the sidewalk with water vaporizer system to fight the summer heat. The price tag is about €50 per person including main course, salad, a small bottle of wine and dessert. In my opinion, a very reasonable ticket considering the quality, the location and the service. It is not a fancy restaurant but a pretty good strakhouse.

review_full: We went to Hache early, by Madrid standards, and all evening the small room filled and filled. I definitely recommend reserving a table. The restaurant is run by a husband and wife with "three great young cooks" behind the scenes.  We had lovely service and enjoyed both steak and tuna tartare and a mar y montana ceviche with crunchy jamon among the cod and creamy accompaniments. Main courses of fish-of-the-day sea bass, entrecôte and magret duck were all splendid. A very short menu and an equally short winelist might cause some people problems but we were delighted with everything we had.

review_full: This place is worth searching for if you are in the Puerta del Sol area. We've eaten here several times during separate trips to Madrid and have always enjoyed our meals. The service can be a little spotty if they are busy but we've always found the wait staff to be friendly. Most of the food is good, although one meat entree off the menu del dia was overcooked and too tough and fatty for my liking. Still, I would not hesitate to come back here. The place is also frequented by plenty of locals, which attests to its authenticity and overall quality.

review_preview: We stopped here for lunch on Saturday 21 May after being overwhelmed by the crowds of people around Puerta del Sol. The peace and quiet just a short way from the hustle and bustle was something of a relief. As we sat down the waiter...
review_full: We stopped here for lunch on Saturday 21 May after being overwhelmed by the crowds of people around Puerta del Sol. The peace and quiet just a short way from the hustle and bustle was something of a relief. As we sat down the waiter served us with complimentary gazpacho and a glass of Cava, definitely a good start. As we have offer beaten Argentinan grilled meat, my wife chose the beef ribs whilst for me it was the entrecote steak, both just how we like them with a good bottle of Rioja to go with our choices. Sorbet to finish. Not the cheapest meal we ate in Madrid this trip, there is a Menu del Did, but it certainly was a pleasant way to spend a couple of hours before returning to the hotel to relax before the night's Bruce Springsteen concert.

title_review: Some of the most flavourful food I have ever eaten...
review_preview: My wife and I were on our first weekend away with our new baby, so it was with some trepidation that we tried to plan dinner out. We needn't have worried however; junior was exhausted from a day of seeing the sights of Madrid and...
review_full: My wife and I were on our first weekend away with our new baby, so it was with some trepidation that we tried to plan dinner out. We needn't have worried however; junior was exhausted from a day of seeing the sights of Madrid and slept through dinner it's entirety. We were eating a little early for the locals (8.30pm) but given our circumstances it worked out very well for us.  The service was excellent, friendly but no overly solicitous. But the main attraction was the food - we ordered the full list of tapas to start with. A highlight was the steak tartare, succulent with a hit of citrus zing and a slight sweet aftertaste, it was actually better than the majority of steak tartares we'd had in France or Switzerland.  For mains we had the duck and the steak, both also delicous, and packed full of favour with a few glasses of the Malbec to wash it down. A highly enjoyable experience, if we are ever back in Madrid we will definitely go again.

review_preview: We went last night and was served by Jose who evidently was newly employed.  We ordered 2 glasses of house white which came with some good bread an an amuse bouche.  I ordered the fish of the day which was hake - it was good...
review_full: We went last night and was served by Jose who evidently was newly employed. We ordered 2 glasses of house white which came with some good bread an an amuse bouche. I ordered the fish of the day which was hake - it was good but not as hot as it should've been. My husband's steak was one of the best. We were persuaded to try a special dessert which was custard like with a wonderful orange taste. We chose a bottle of crianza at €18. Complementary digestif was served. Then the bill appeared - which we had not asked for. It was €66. Rather unusual, but we paid and then saw that Jose was ending his shift. By this time (2130) there was only us and another couple in the restaurant area behind the bar. The owner spent much time chatting with the other couple, not once did he turn his head to neither greet us or ask if we'd enjoyed our evening. We thought this was poor from the owner of a new restaurant who by all accounts is supposed to be friendly and knowledgeable about wine. Upon leaving I asked the waitress if I may have a word and politely told him that it would've been nice if he had acknowledged us.

review_preview: A very hot day for this season and four of us were parched.  Chose this place for the shade, even though it looked a bit pretentious. What a perfect choice!Federico was our waiter and he was attentive and gracious. We ordered gin and tonics....
review_full: A very hot day for this season and four of us were parched. Chose this place for the shade, even though it looked a bit pretentious. What a perfect choice! Federico was our waiter and he was attentive and gracious. We ordered gin and tonics. Generous pours at the table and reasonable price considering the location.  After getting refreshed we decided to eat our main meal for the day with more drinks. Chose the ribeye. Delicious and very tender! No marbling and nicely marinated. It was quite salty, so if you are sensitive to that, be sure to ask them to hold the sprinkle added right before they serve it. Price for the steak is on the spendy side, but IMHO, it's worth it.  This place has been open about 6 weeks and they are trying hard and succeeding.

review_preview: My boyfriend and I had dinner last week in La Raquetista. My boyfriend was excited as he had been there before. I was impressed about how popular this place is, first when you get in, you see a bunch of people in the bar and...
review_full: My boyfriend and I had dinner last week in La Raquetista. My boyfriend was excited as he had been there before.  I was impressed about how popular this place is, first when you get in, you see a bunch of people in the bar and then someone scorts you to your table which is in the back part of La Raquetista.  There are like 8 tables in all the restaurant, which provides a cozy atmosphere and a very nice and exclusive feeling. Food is delicious, first they bring you a complementary lentils soup, which is delicious. Then you start with the experience. title_review: A Hidden Treasure in the Heart of Madrid
review_preview: We stumbled across this restaurant on our first night in Madrid having walked to see the Palace at night. If you continue walking past plaza de oriente and past the palace gardens at the rear of the palace Hache sits not far from here on...
review_full: We stumbled across this restaurant on our first night in Madrid having walked to see the Palace at night. If you continue walking past plaza de oriente and past the palace gardens at the rear of the palace Hache sits not far from here on the opposite side of the road from the palace. What a treat of a restaurant to stumble across on our first night!  Firstly the owners were lovely! Welcoming us into their restaurant and by the time you leave you feel like you have made a new friend. The food is stunning and the drinks are great with decent prices for the quality you will see. The bar does everything from massive gin and tonics which come in balloon shaped glasses (something we found to be very popular in Madrid), great wines and one of the best sangrias in Madrid!  The food was so tasty, on our first visit we sat at the bar side of the restaurant sampling the tapas and drinks which were a modern twist on old tapas classics! So tasty and would highly recommend this for a late night snack. On our second visit we dined in the restaurant for lunch and had a larger portion of meatballs with a goats cheese sauce which we had the first time and enjoyed so much we had to go back for more. Then we had beef which was so tender and duck which was delicious.  Overall we would highly recommend this restaurant for its great and friendly service, amazing food, and great drinks. Very reasonably priced too for such a high quality experience. If we are ever in Madrid again we will definitely visit again! Thank you Hache! Salut!

review_full: We decided to dine close to our hotel near the Palacio Real and tried a little restaurant, “Hache”, recommended to us. Unusual night because both of Madrid's football teams were in the European Cup final and there was not a soul out in Madrid. We were the only people there and could hear the sounds of the game with accompanying cheers and groans coming from the kitchen. The owner explained one chef went for Real and the other went for Athletico. Really quite funny! They managed to put on a good meal though and our entre tapas was fabulous - the best croquettes yet and salmon tartar on avocado mash with wasabi. The owner chatted with us and shared his family's history with us. Spain is such an interesting place. This became our go to place and dined here several times.

review_preview: It was our last night in Madrid and we had been living on tapas; we wanted a nice, sit-down dinner, so we started walking around looking for the right place.  It's conveniently located just off Puerta del Sol and they have indoor and outdoor dining...
review_full: It was our last night in Madrid and we had been living on tapas; we wanted a nice, sit-down dinner, so we started walking around looking for the right place. It's conveniently located just off Puerta del Sol and they have indoor and outdoor dining and a bar; we opted to sit outside and enjoy a beautiful evening. They are down a quiet side street and there were no crowds to contend with. It's a white tablecloth kinda place. Before we started, they brought out free bread and olives, and a free glass of jerez (sherry). We had a lovely dinner; everyone was pleased with their selection and then they offered dessert. We thought that we might walk dinner off and find dessert elsewhere, so we declined. Well, that is when they brought out not one, but two, desserts, on the house. Then they followed that with an after dinner liqueur. In all, they gave us five (5) items on the house. The waitress was so cute when she would bring it to us and declare, "It's on the house!". We stumbled upon the perfect finale to our Madrid visit - we loved it! And to top it off, the prices were very reasonable, about $30 per person including tip.

review_full: Unassuming restaurant from the outside, but this new restaurant of three month old (May 2016) is a surprising find. The owner Mr Francisco has a passion for fine wine and good food. I tried the steak tartar, salmon tartar and sticky rice with grilled prawns. I loved the salmon tartar best. Being Asian, I am amazed by the fusion of salmon sashimi fused with guacamole; simply delicious - even my demanding wife agreed that it is great. Pair the Matarromera wine with the sticky rice and oh gosh, they are a perfect match. The steak tartar has just a right mix of beef and whatever sour vegetable that is mixed with it that satisfied my strong Asian taste bugs. Best lunch that I have had in my short Spain trip.

review_preview: Carmencita Bar is the brunch hit in Madrid, the buzz is over town and you feel like you need to go.ok, you dont really have to go becuase its not all that special but if you are hungry and on a budget it is...
review_full: Carmencita Bar is the brunch hit in Madrid, the buzz is over town and you feel like you need to go. ok, you dont really have to go becuase its not all that special but if you are hungry and on a budget it is an ok place to visit. location isnt the best, its just outisde of town and the Noviciado metro station is closest by (line 2, 3 stops from Sol), then a 400 meter walk through a pretty rough area. there are 2 location in the same street having the same name, so that doesnt help either. the food: tasteful and brought to you fast. its mostly eggs and salad with baked potatoes and you have some other choices to add some drinks and coffee/tea. value for money if you take the EUR14 menu is pretty good. you walk out with enough calories to last you to dinner about 10 hours later. Service: they do there best but its like a someone have never done it before. 1 girl behind the counter doing all the drinks, 1 guy walking around doing all the writing and 1 girl doing all the serving. .its a bit of a mess with proper and good intentions but it doesnt really look profesional or customer focussed. On the other hand, its a Sunday brunch, what do I care? the place itselfs has a 50/60s americana style but made european. it looks like the place needs a lick of paint here and there but its not that bothersome. overal: relaxed place to have a lunch/brunch but nothing really special. food is ok and value for money is good. Worth to try, not sure if I will be a regular.

The mimosas are €1, and the triple eggs Benny (1 each of bacon, avocado, and salmon) was €10.50, but they happily replaced my salmon with an extra avocado Benny. They even let me do half salad, half pan fried, but the salad was great and the bennies decadent so I would skip the potatoes next time.  The cafe con leche was €1.70. A great bargain meal that kept me full until I ate 9 hours later after a day of walking.

title_review: Liked it so much we went back the next day for more
review_preview: My wife and I had just spent the morning wandering around the beautiful Buen Retiro Park and worked up an appetite. We hadn't booked anywhere so decided we would have a look round some of the nearby side streets to see what was there. By...
review_full: My wife and I had just spent the morning wandering around the beautiful Buen Retiro Park and worked up an appetite. We hadn't booked anywhere so decided we would have a look round some of the nearby side streets to see what was there. By chance we stumbled across La Vanduca. They had a table available inside and seemed very welcoming, as did the restaurant. Even better for a couple (us) who speak next to no Spanish, some of the staff spoke very good English. The tapas menu looked inviting so we made our selections. We were offered the option of having each dish in the order we selected but received a broad smile and a polite 'thank you' when we replied 'we don't mind'. Our waiter did urge us to have some bread and olives. Ordinarily we would pass on this but decided to have some anyway. Note to self, and anyone else for that matter......make sure you have the bread in this restaurant, it is sensational, and the olives too. We ate all of the olives, in pretty quick fashion I might add; they we so delicious. We'd ordered about half a dozen dishes and all, with the possible exception of the meatballs, were excellent. The meatballs were okay but it was probably more a case of the other five dishes being so good. Anyway, the following day we were downtown and when the discussion started about where we should eat it quickly became an easy decision....we'd go back to La Vanduca again, and so we did. This time we didn't have the meatballs and this time every dish was excellent. If we do go back to Madrid, its a no brainer where we will have at least one lunch.

review_full: I booked a table on line and when we got there we were greeted by very welcoming and helpful staff. They went out of their way to bring us much more than the standard poppadoms. We ordered chicken curry, chana masala, paneer sizzler, kadai paneer, raita, onion salad, rice, garlic naan, cheese naan and Tandoori rotis. The staff were very very attentive and asked properly what kind of heat etc we wanted the food to be made at. At one point my clumsy son managed to drop a few grains of rice into my glass of water and the Waitress kept insisting that she would happily change the glass. My daughter (the only meat eater amongst us) who normally is very fussy with her food ate all of her chicken curry which is a true testament to how good it must have been. The chana masala was very good as was the kadai paneer. The paneer sizzler too was of a high standard. The naans and rotis were fresh and hot. We had gajjar halwa and ice cream which was truly out of this world. I will definitely visit this restaurant again if I'm ever in Madrid.

review_preview: We just walked in as it was close to our hotel.  Little did we know we were in for a great meal and lively atmosphere.  I had the Tuscan burger,and would agree, it was delicious.  It had ham and avocado, and was rich and delicious....
review_full: We just walked in as it was close to our hotel. Little did we know we were in for a great meal and lively atmosphere. I had the Tuscan burger,and would agree, it was delicious. It had ham and avocado, and was rich and delicious. The home fries were excellent and the sliders (MasQueSea) was great for 4 little mini burgers. The beer on tap was delicious and not too hoppy, and the Spanish cooked ham with grilled provolone and quail eggs was special. Thus mushrooms, avocado and parmesan cheese was OK. The owner Mary-Ann is from Arizona and has perfect English. Nice to speak to as well. Very attentive service and good music in this place. They are more of a restaurant than a bar. Really enjoyed the place. Would go back for this famous brunch I've heard about.
